user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2 code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 1.2.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2.
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                               const char *realm,
                               const char *opaque,
                               struct MHD_Response *response,
                               int signal_stale,
                               enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgorithm algo)
{
  enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 algo3;

  if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_MD5 == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_MD5;
  else if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_SHA256 == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA256;
  else if (MHD_DIGEST_ALG_AUTO == algo)
    algo3 = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_ANY_NON_SESSION;
  else
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Wrong algo value.\n")); /* API violation! */

  return MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (connection, realm, opaque,
                                            NULL, response, signal_stale,
                                            MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_QOP_AUTH,
                                            algo3,
                                            0, 0);
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
The function declaration uses the macro _MHD_EXTERN which expands to __attribute__((visibility("default"))) extern. The GCC/Clang __attribute__((...)) syntax is a compiler-specific language extension (documented as such), so this use violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
</scenario>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_queue_auth_fail_response2:
#define _MHD_EXTERN __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern
...
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
</additional code>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation: The report is correct. The function declaration uses the macro _MHD_EXTERN which (as shown) expands to __attribute__((visibility("default"))) extern. The __attribute__((...)) syntax is a GCC/Clang compiler attribute syntax and is documented as a compiler extension (i.e. not standard ISO C). MISRA C:2023 Rule 1.2 forbids the use of language/compiler extensions, so the presence of that attribute (even when hidden behind a macro) constitutes a violation. (Note: other macros such as BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED or any use of __builtin_* would also be additional extensions if present.)
